        Creates a new Cube to which an initial Algorithm is applied

        Whether the cube is properly solved, i.e. it is equivalent to a solved cube.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Returns whether this Cube is equivalent to another Object (Cube).
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - the Object to compare this cube to
        Returns:
        true iff o is a Cube and there is a rotation in which the two Cubes are identical.

      • rotate

        private static int rotate(int movedPiece,
                          int rotation)
        Rotates the given piece by the specified rotation. For example (5610, 1) ↦ 5611
        Parameters:
        movedPiece - the integral encoding of the piece to be rotatd
        rotation - the number of times the piece is supposed to be rotated clockwise
        Returns:
        the integral encoding of the rotated piece

      • pieceToArray

        private static int[] pieceToArray(int piece)
        Splits an integer into an array of its digits. Note that String.join can be used to recover the numbers String representation.
        Parameters:
        piece - the integer to be split
        Returns:
        the array containing the digits of the input integer

      • order

        private static int order(int[] pieceArray)
        The order of the array representation of a pieces integral representation. Centers, edges and corners each have order 1, 2 or 3.
        Parameters:
        pieceArray -
        Returns:

      • cyclePieces

        private void cyclePieces(int offset,
                         Sticker[] target,
                         int[] rotation)
        Performs a cycling of the pieces of the current cube given the raw data provided by a Turn.
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset, how many pieces to skip in the current cycling (usually 2 such that corners, edges and centers are each mapped to the same piece type).
        target - the stickers to be cycled
        rotation - the rotation applied to each sticker upon cycling.

      • getFaceletDefinition

        public java.lang.String getFaceletDefinition()
        Returns:
        the facelet definition as used by the 2-phase algorithms cube implementation
